segment.source: Set up Take a Test on multiple PCs
segment.target: Set up Take a Test on multiple PCs

segment.source: Learn how to set up and use the Take a Test app on multiple PCs.
segment.target: Learn how to set up and use the Take a Test app on multiple PCs.

segment.source: Set up Take a Test on multiple PCs (Preview)
segment.target: Set up Take a Test on multiple PCs (Preview)

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10 Insider Preview
segment.target: Windows 10 Insider Preview

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.

segment.source: Many schools use online testing for formative and summative assessments.
segment.target: Many schools use online testing for formative and summative assessments.

segment.source: It's critical that students use a secure browser that prevents them from using other computer or Internet resources during the test.
segment.target: It's critical that students use a secure browser that prevents them from using other computer or Internet resources during the test.

segment.source: The Take a Test app in Windows 10, Version 1607, creates the right environment for taking a test:
segment.target: The Take a Test app in Windows 10, Version 1607, creates the right environment for taking a test:

segment.source: A Microsoft Edge browser window opens, showing just the test and nothing else.
segment.target: A Microsoft Edge browser window opens, showing just the test and nothing else.

segment.source: Students aren’t able to go to other websites.
segment.target: Students aren’t able to go to other websites.

segment.source: Students can’t open or access other apps.
segment.target: Students can’t open or access other apps.

segment.source: Students can't share, print, or record their screens.
segment.target: Students can't share, print, or record their screens.

segment.source: Students can’t copy or paste.
segment.target: Students can’t copy or paste.

segment.source: Students can’t change settings, extend their display, see notifications, get updates, or use autofill features.
segment.target: Students can’t change settings, extend their display, see notifications, get updates, or use autofill features.

segment.source: Cortana is turned off.
segment.target: Cortana is turned off.

segment.source: How you use Take a Test
segment.target: How you use Take a Test

segment.source: Use test account or test url in Take a Test
segment.target: Use test account or test url in Take a Test

segment.source: Use a test URL and a dedicated testing account - A user signs in to the account and the Take a Test app automatically launches the pre-configured assessment URL in Microsoft Edge in a single-app, kiosk mode.
segment.target: Use a test URL and a dedicated testing account - A user signs in to the account and the Take a Test app automatically launches the pre-configured assessment URL in Microsoft Edge in a single-app, kiosk mode.

segment.source: A student will never have access to the desktop in this configuration.
segment.target: A student will never have access to the desktop in this configuration.

segment.source: We recommend this configuration for high stakes testing.
segment.target: We recommend this configuration for high stakes testing.

segment.source: Put a test URL with an included prefix on a web page or OneNote for students to click - This allows teachers and test administrators an easier way to deploy assessments.
segment.target: Put a test URL with an included prefix on a web page or OneNote for students to click - This allows teachers and test administrators an easier way to deploy assessments.

segment.source: We recommend this method for lower stakes assessments.
segment.target: We recommend this method for lower stakes assessments.

segment.source: Set up a dedicated test account
segment.target: Set up a dedicated test account

segment.source: To configure a dedicated test account on multiple PCs, you can use:
segment.target: To configure a dedicated test account on multiple PCs, you can use:

segment.source: Mobile device management (MDM) or Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager
segment.target: Mobile device management (MDM) or Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager

segment.source: A provisioning package created in Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD)
segment.target: A provisioning package created in Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD)

segment.source: Group Policy to deploy a scheduled task that runs a Powershell script
segment.target: Group Policy to deploy a scheduled task that runs a Powershell script

segment.source: Set up test account in MDM or Configuration Manager
segment.target: Set up test account in MDM or Configuration Manager

segment.source: Launch your management console.
segment.target: Launch your management console.

segment.source: Create a policy to set up single app kiosk mode, using the following values:
segment.target: Create a policy to set up single app kiosk mode, using the following values:

segment.source: Custom OMA-DM URI = ./Vendor/MSFT/AssignedAccess/KioskModeApp
segment.target: Custom OMA-DM URI = ./Vendor/MSFT/AssignedAccess/KioskModeApp

segment.source: String value = {"Account":"redmondkioskuser","AUMID":” Microsoft.Windows.SecureAssessmentBrowser_cw5n1h2txyewy!App "}
segment.target: String value = {"Account":"redmondkioskuser","AUMID":” Microsoft.Windows.SecureAssessmentBrowser_cw5n1h2txyewy!App "}

segment.source: Account can be in one of the following formats:
segment.target: Account can be in one of the following formats:

segment.source: username
segment.target: username

segment.source: domain\username
segment.target: domain\username

segment.source: computer nameusername
segment.target: computer nameusername

segment.source: username@tenant.com
segment.target: username@tenant.com

segment.source: Create a policy to configure the assessment URL, using the following values:
segment.target: Create a policy to configure the assessment URL, using the following values:

segment.source: Custom OMA-DM URI = ./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/LaunchURI
segment.target: Custom OMA-DM URI = ./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/LaunchURI

segment.source: See Assessment URLs
segment.target: See Assessment URLs

segment.source: Create a policy that associates the assessment URL to the account, using the following values:
segment.target: Create a policy that associates the assessment URL to the account, using the following values:

segment.source: Custom OMA-DM URI = ./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/TesterAccount
segment.target: Custom OMA-DM URI = ./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/TesterAccount

segment.source: String value = Enter the account that you specified in step 2, using the same account format.
segment.target: String value = Enter the account that you specified in step 2, using the same account format.

segment.source: To take the test, the student signs in to the test account.
segment.target: To take the test, the student signs in to the test account.

segment.source: Set up test account in a provisioning package
segment.target: Set up test account in a provisioning package

segment.source: Prerequisite: You must first download the Windows ADK for Windows 10, Version 1607, and install Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).
segment.target: Prerequisite: You must first download the Windows ADK for Windows 10, Version 1607, and install Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).

segment.source: **Create a provisioning package to set up a test account
segment.target: **Create a provisioning package to set up a test account

segment.source: Open Windows ICD (by default, %windir%\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Assessment and Deployment Kit\Imaging and Configuration Designer\x86\ICD.exe).
segment.target: Open Windows ICD (by default, %windir%\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Assessment and Deployment Kit\Imaging and Configuration Designer\x86\ICD.exe).

segment.source: Select Advanced provisioning.
segment.target: Select Advanced provisioning.

segment.source: Name your project, and click Next.
segment.target: Name your project, and click Next.

segment.source: Select All Windows desktop editions, and click Next.
segment.target: Select All Windows desktop editions, and click Next.

segment.source: Click Finish.
segment.target: Click Finish.

segment.source: Go to Runtime settingsAssignedAccessAssignedAccessSettings.
segment.target: Go to Runtime settingsAssignedAccessAssignedAccessSettings.

segment.source: Enter {"Account":"redmondkioskuser","AUMID":” Microsoft.Windows.SecureAssessmentBrowser_cw5n1h2txyewy!App "}**, using the account that you want to set up, as shown in the following image.
segment.target: Enter {"Account":"redmondkioskuser","AUMID":” Microsoft.Windows.SecureAssessmentBrowser_cw5n1h2txyewy!App "}**, using the account that you want to set up, as shown in the following image.

segment.source: Enter account and app for Assigned Access Settings
segment.target: Enter account and app for Assigned Access Settings

segment.source: Account can be in one of the following formats:
segment.target: Account can be in one of the following formats:

segment.source: username
segment.target: username

segment.source: domain\username
segment.target: domain\username

segment.source: computer nameusername
segment.target: computer nameusername

segment.source: username@tenant.com
segment.target: username@tenant.com

segment.source: Go to Runtime settingsTakeATest.
segment.target: Go to Runtime settingsTakeATest.

segment.source: Enter the test URL in LaunchURI.
segment.target: Enter the test URL in LaunchURI.

segment.source: Enter the test account from step 7 in TesterAccount.
segment.target: Enter the test account from step 7 in TesterAccount.

segment.source: On the File menu, select Save.
segment.target: On the File menu, select Save.

segment.source: On the Export menu, select Provisioning package.
segment.target: On the Export menu, select Provisioning package.

segment.source: Change Owner to IT Admin, which will set the precedence of this provisioning package higher than provisioning packages applied to this device from other sources, and then select Next.
segment.target: Change Owner to IT Admin, which will set the precedence of this provisioning package higher than provisioning packages applied to this device from other sources, and then select Next.

segment.source: Optional.
segment.target: Optional.

segment.source: In the Provisioning package security window, you can choose to encrypt the package and enable package signing.
segment.target: In the Provisioning package security window, you can choose to encrypt the package and enable package signing.

segment.source: Enable package encryption - If you select this option, an auto-generated password will be shown on the screen.
segment.target: Enable package encryption - If you select this option, an auto-generated password will be shown on the screen.

segment.source: Enable package signing - If you select this option, you must select a valid certificate to use for signing the package.
segment.target: Enable package signing - If you select this option, you must select a valid certificate to use for signing the package.

segment.source: You can specify the certificate by clicking Select and choosing the certificate you want to use to sign the package.
segment.target: You can specify the certificate by clicking Select and choosing the certificate you want to use to sign the package.

segment.source: Click Next to specify the output location where you want the provisioning package to go when it's built.
segment.target: Click Next to specify the output location where you want the provisioning package to go when it's built.

segment.source: By default, Windows ICD uses the project folder as the output location.
segment.target: By default, Windows ICD uses the project folder as the output location.

segment.source: Optionally, you can click Browse to change the default output location.
segment.target: Optionally, you can click Browse to change the default output location.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Click Build to start building the package.
segment.target: Click Build to start building the package.

segment.source: The provisioning package doesn't take long to build.
segment.target: The provisioning package doesn't take long to build.

segment.source: The project information is displayed in the build page and the progress bar indicates the build status.
segment.target: The project information is displayed in the build page and the progress bar indicates the build status.

segment.source: If you need to cancel the build, click Cancel.
segment.target: If you need to cancel the build, click Cancel.

segment.source: This cancels the current build process, closes the wizard, and takes you back to the Customizations Page.
segment.target: This cancels the current build process, closes the wizard, and takes you back to the Customizations Page.

segment.source: If your build fails, an error message will show up that includes a link to the project folder.
segment.target: If your build fails, an error message will show up that includes a link to the project folder.

segment.source: You can scan the logs to determine what caused the error.
segment.target: You can scan the logs to determine what caused the error.

segment.source: Once you fix the issue, try building the package again.
segment.target: Once you fix the issue, try building the package again.

segment.source: If your build is successful, the name of the provisioning package, output directory, and project directory will be shown.
segment.target: If your build is successful, the name of the provisioning package, output directory, and project directory will be shown.

segment.source: If you choose, you can build the provisioning package again and pick a different path for the output package.
segment.target: If you choose, you can build the provisioning package again and pick a different path for the output package.

segment.source: To do this, click Back to change the output package name and path, and then click Next to start another build.
segment.target: To do this, click Back to change the output package name and path, and then click Next to start another build.

segment.source: If you are done, click Finish to close the wizard and go back to the Customizations Page.
segment.target: If you are done, click Finish to close the wizard and go back to the Customizations Page.

segment.source: Apply the provisioning package
segment.target: Apply the provisioning package

segment.source: Select the provisioning package that you want to apply, double-click the file, and then allow admin privileges.
segment.target: Select the provisioning package that you want to apply, double-click the file, and then allow admin privileges.

segment.source: Consent to allow the package to be installed.
segment.target: Consent to allow the package to be installed.

segment.source: After you allow the package to be installed, the settings will be applied to the device
segment.target: After you allow the package to be installed, the settings will be applied to the device

segment.source: Learn how to apply a provisioning package in audit mode or OOBE.
segment.target: Learn how to apply a provisioning package in audit mode or OOBE.

segment.source: Set up test account in Group Policy
segment.target: Set up test account in Group Policy

segment.source: To set up a test account using Group Policy, first create a Powershell script that configures the test account and test URL, and then create a scheduled task to run the script.
segment.target: To set up a test account using Group Policy, first create a Powershell script that configures the test account and test URL, and then create a scheduled task to run the script.

segment.source: Create a Powershell script
segment.target: Create a Powershell script

segment.source: This sample Powershell script configures the test account and the test URL.
segment.target: This sample Powershell script configures the test account and the test URL.

segment.source: Edit the sample to:
segment.target: Edit the sample to:

segment.source: Use your test account for $obj.LaunchURI
segment.target: Use your test account for $obj.LaunchURI

segment.source: Use your test URL for $obj.TesterAccount
segment.target: Use your test URL for $obj.TesterAccount

segment.source: Use your test account for -UserName
segment.target: Use your test account for -UserName

segment.source: Create a scheduled task in Group Policy
segment.target: Create a scheduled task in Group Policy

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management Console.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management Console.

segment.source: Right-click the Group Policy object (GPO) that should contain the new preference item, and then click Edit.
segment.target: Right-click the Group Policy object (GPO) that should contain the new preference item, and then click Edit.

segment.source: In the console tree under Computer Configuration or User Configuration, go to PreferencesControl Panel Settings.
segment.target: In the console tree under Computer Configuration or User Configuration, go to PreferencesControl Panel Settings.

segment.source: Right-click Scheduled Tasks, point to New, and select Scheduled Task.
segment.target: Right-click Scheduled Tasks, point to New, and select Scheduled Task.

segment.source: In the New Scheduled Task Properties dialog box, click Change User or Group.
segment.target: In the New Scheduled Task Properties dialog box, click Change User or Group.

segment.source: In the Select User or Group dialog box, click Advanced.
segment.target: In the Select User or Group dialog box, click Advanced.

segment.source: In the Advanced dialog box, click Find Now.
segment.target: In the Advanced dialog box, click Find Now.

segment.source: Select System in the search results
segment.target: Select System in the search results

segment.source: Go back to the Properties dialog box and select Run with highest privileges under Security options.
segment.target: Go back to the Properties dialog box and select Run with highest privileges under Security options.

segment.source: Specify the operating system in the Configure for field.
segment.target: Specify the operating system in the Configure for field.

segment.source: Navigate to the Actions tab.
segment.target: Navigate to the Actions tab.

segment.source: Create a new Action.
segment.target: Create a new Action.

segment.source: Configure the action to Start a program.
segment.target: Configure the action to Start a program.

segment.source: In the Program/script field, enter powershell.
segment.target: In the Program/script field, enter powershell.

segment.source: In the Add arguments field, enter -file “”.
segment.target: In the Add arguments field, enter -file “”.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Navigate to the Triggers tab and create a new trigger.
segment.target: Navigate to the Triggers tab and create a new trigger.

segment.source: Specify the trigger to be On a schedule.
segment.target: Specify the trigger to be On a schedule.

segment.source: Specify the trigger to be One time.
segment.target: Specify the trigger to be One time.

segment.source: Specify the time the trigger should start.
segment.target: Specify the time the trigger should start.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: In the Settings tab, select Run task as soon as possible after a scheduled start is missed.
segment.target: In the Settings tab, select Run task as soon as possible after a scheduled start is missed.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Provide link to test
segment.target: Provide link to test

segment.source: Anything hosted on the web can be presented in a locked down manner, not just assessments.
segment.target: Anything hosted on the web can be presented in a locked down manner, not just assessments.

segment.source: To lock down online content, just embed a URL with a specific prefix and devices will be locked down when users follow the link.
segment.target: To lock down online content, just embed a URL with a specific prefix and devices will be locked down when users follow the link.

segment.source: We recommend using this method for lower stakes assessments.
segment.target: We recommend using this method for lower stakes assessments.

segment.source: Create a link to the test URL.
segment.target: Create a link to the test URL.

segment.source: Use ms-edu-secureassessment: before the URL and !enforceLockdown after the URL.
segment.target: Use ms-edu-secureassessment: before the URL and !enforceLockdown after the URL.

segment.source: Note: You may want to remove !enforceLockdown for tests that utilizes our lockdown API that checks for running processes before locking down.
segment.target: Note: You may want to remove !enforceLockdown for tests that utilizes our lockdown API that checks for running processes before locking down.

segment.source: Removing !enforceLockdown will result in the app not locking down immediately which allows you to close apps that are not allowed to run during lockdown.
segment.target: Removing !enforceLockdown will result in the app not locking down immediately which allows you to close apps that are not allowed to run during lockdown.

segment.source: The test web application may lock down the device once you have closed the apps.
segment.target: The test web application may lock down the device once you have closed the apps.

segment.source: Distribute the link.
segment.target: Distribute the link.

segment.source: You can use the web, email, OneNote, or any other method of your choosing.
segment.target: You can use the web, email, OneNote, or any other method of your choosing.

segment.source: To take the test, the student clicks on the link and provides user consent.
segment.target: To take the test, the student clicks on the link and provides user consent.

segment.source: Assessment URLs
segment.target: Assessment URLs

segment.source: This assessment URL uses our lockdown API:
segment.target: This assessment URL uses our lockdown API:

segment.source: SBAC/AIR: http://mobile.tds.airast.org/launchpad/.
segment.target: SBAC/AIR: http://mobile.tds.airast.org/launchpad/.
